page.title: 09RICHMOND PARK
page.content: Richmond Park is an enormous park which attracts many visitors. People can drive through the park from Sheen, Ham, Richmond and many other gates. In the park there are rabbits, deer and lovely plants to see.{Pen Ponds}are situated in the middle of the park and consist of two ponds separated by a gravel path. Many ducks and swans live on these ponds and bream, roach, carp and eels all swim in the ponds under the beautiful water lilies.{ {Pembroke Lodge}near Richmond Gate is the living quarters for all the park staff but also has a restaurant and coffee house for the public which has beautiful views over the park and valley. Its gardens are superb.
